intro: Eriocaulon umbellatum, commonly known as the umbrella sedge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. It thrives in wetland environments, often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its botanical features make it an important species in aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
